intro: Lomatium suksdorfii var. thompsonii, commonly known as Thompson's lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive fern-like appearance. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
